queries.dsl: FETCH(first_name, COUNT(*)) FILTER(first_name CONTAINS 'm') FROM students GROUPBY(first_name) HAVING (COUNT(*) >= 25)
queries.postgres: SELECT students.first_name, COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE students.first_name LIKE '%m%' GROUP BY students.first_name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 25
queries.mssql: SELECT students.first_name, COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE students.first_name LIKE '%m%' GROUP BY students.first_name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 25
queries.mysql: SELECT students.first_name, COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE students.first_name LIKE '%m%' GROUP BY students.first_name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 25
queries.oracle: SELECT students.first_name, COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE students.first_name LIKE '%m%' GROUP BY students.first_name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 25

queries.dsl: FETCH(first_name, COUNT(*)) FROM students FILTER(LOWER(first_name) CONTAINS 'm') GROUPBY(first_name) HAVING(COUNT(*) >= 20) ORDERBY(COUNT(*) DESC)
queries.postgres: SELECT s.first_name, COUNT(*) AS cnt FROM students s WHERE LOWER(s.first_name) LIKE '%m%' GROUP BY s.first_name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 20 ORDER BY cnt DESC
queries.mysql: SELECT s.first_name, COUNT(*) AS cnt FROM students s WHERE LOWER(s.first_name) LIKE '%m%' GROUP BY s.first_name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 20 ORDER BY cnt DESC
queries.mssql: SELECT s.first_name, COUNT(*) AS cnt FROM students s WHERE LOWER(s.first_name) LIKE '%m%' GROUP BY s.first_name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 20 ORDER BY cnt DESC
queries.oracle: SELECT s.first_name, COUNT(*) cnt FROM students s WHERE LOWER(s.first_name) LIKE '%m%' GROUP BY s.first_name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 20 ORDER BY cnt DESC
